title: Calories in One Reese's Cup
meta_description: Discover calories in one reeses cup, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, carbs, protein, and quick tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard single Reese's Peanut Butter Cup (21 g), milk chocolate with peanut butter filling; no additional toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, exact size, recipe changes, and manufacturing; check packaging for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One standard Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 105 kcal and 2.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one Reese's cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 105 kcal for a standard size.

faqs.q: What are the macros in one Reese's Peanut Butter Cup?
faqs.a: About 8 g fat, 11 g carbs (9 g sugars), and 2.5 g protein.

faqs.q: Does one Reese's cup have trans fat?
faqs.a: Typically 0 g trans fat in standard Reese's cups.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in one Reese's cup?
Are Reese's cups high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, with about 9 g sugars per cup, mainly from chocolate and filling.
